abstract: Article in Columbia Journalism School publication prompts examination of B110 bus line in Brooklyn, on which men are seated in front and women must ride in the back; Transportation Dept says that even though private operator runs bus, which caters to Hasidic Jewish community, it is for public use and cannot discriminate.
snippet: An article in a Columbia Journalism School publication has prompted a review of the B110 line in Brooklyn, on which women are to ride in the back.
lead_paragraph: An article in a Columbia Journalism School publication has prompted a review of the B110 line in Brooklyn, on which women are to ride in the back.

headline.main: At Front of Brooklyn Bus, a Clash of Religious and Women’s Rights
headline.print_headline: At Front of Brooklyn Bus, a Clash of Religious and Women’s Rights
headline.seo: Bus Segregation of Jewish Women Prompts Review
